CONVERSATION GROUP: Left click on the ground to move your player.
Right click and drag to rotate the camera. Hold the middle mouse and drag to move the camera. Double click your character or portrait to center the camera on your character.

Pan the camera by holding and dragging with the middle mouse button. This is useful for scouting the surrounding area for danger. BK slight tweaks -  Panning disables the camera follow behavior, however double-clicking on a party member (or his / her portrait) re-centers the view and follows that character.

BK needed to add "them"
Hold the Alt key to highlight any interactive items in the area. Click on objects like chests to move to and interact with  automatically.
To equip an item open your inventory and double click on the item or click on the equip button.

BK I removed the specific reference to the button's location. I didn't see it as necessary and in case it ever changes...

Equip your Weapon, Armor, and Boots by selecting the item and pressing “Equip.” Alternatively, double-clicking or dragging-and-dropping an item also equips it. Press the “Close” button in the bottom right or hit Esc to exit the Inventory.

BK - removing mention of type, level, health. Level was removed from the interface and I'm not sure what type means (their name?) 
Hover your cursor over an enemy to display their type, level, and health.  Left click to target and attack. Your character will fight until the enemy is defeated or you choose to disengage.

You can attack an enemy by highlighting them with your cursor and clicking the left mouse button. This will engage the auto-attack, 
Hover your cursor over an enemy to display their type, level, and health.  Left click to target and attack. Your character will fight until the enemy is defeated or you choose to disengage.


when auto-attack is active the player will continue to use the default attack against an enemy until the enemy is defeated or the player changes the target.

Abilities, Potions, and Scrolls reside in the Quickbar at the bottom of the screen. Hover your cursor over the ability or item for info and left click to activate it (or press the assigned key). Some require left clicking a target once activated (right click to cancel).
You can take control of your part members by clicking on their character portraits.
Make good use of your party. When facing a challenging battle, use pause to cycle through party members and strategically use their full range of offensive and defensive abilities.
Neddy has the Search ability, which can reveal hidden traps and treasure. Click on Search in the Quickbar and scout ahead to look for traps.

Some classes have one or more Cantrips available. The Quickbar displays the default Weapon Set (left) and any Cantrips (right). For characters like Gill, clicking on either slot makes the Weapon or Cantrip his default attack. To switch between multiple Cantrips, click the swap icon in the bottom right corner.
You've been spotted. An enemy has been able to perceive you through your stealth.
Companions who aren't in your active party can maintain contact via sending stones.
Characters like Rogues can be more skilled at picking locks. Try using Neddy to open the locked chest.
Characters not directly under your control will automatically follow and fight tactically as needed. Clicking the icon below and to the right of the Character Portraits toggles this behavior.

Side Quests are displayed in your Quest Log, just below the Main Quest. Hit “J” to open the Journal (or select it from the Pause menu) to review all Active / Completed Quests and choose which Side Quest you’d like to track. All new Side Quests are tracked automatically. Only one Side Quest can be tracked at a time but the Main Quest is always shown.

Press “M” to open your Map (or select it from the Pause Menu). The Local Map represents the surrounding area explored by your party, revealing more as you progress. Adjust zoom using the mouse wheel and pan the map by holding and dragging with the middle mouse button.
